page.title: 14FARMS IN WOOKEY HOLE
page.content:
NEAR WOOKEY HOLE VILLAGE THERE ARE FOUR DAIRY FARMS.FARMERS TAKE THEIR CATTLE TO MARKET FREQUENTLY TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF COWS,OR TO PAY FOR SOME MATERIALS. EVERY YEAR THEY HARVEST THEIR CROPS,FERTILIZE,SPRAY AND MAKE SILAGE AND THEN BALE,USUALLY IN JUNE,JULY AND AUGUST.
ALL THE FARMS HAVE OLD BUILDINGS AND SHEDS WHICH WERE MADE FROM NATURAL LIMESTONE QUARRIED FROM THE MENDIP HILLS.SOME OF THE OLD BUILDINGS ARE STILL IN USE NOW FOR STORING CATTLE FEED OR FERTILIZER BAGS OR IF THE OLD SHEDS ARE BIG ENOUGH THEY WILL BE USED FOR MILKING.
MOST OTHER FARMS IN THE AREA ARE ALSO DAIRY OR MIXED FARMS.
